706236f-a.text:
68-76 Pennsylvania Ave., west side, north of Atlantic Ave. To the right partially seen, is the Tyrian Temple. The building bearing the sign was the old New Lots post-office, said to have been built by a Col. Brown (?) in the 1870's. His son Miles A. Brown was postmaster in 1874.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706236f-a.folder: Pennsylvania Avenue & Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

706237f-a.text:
Pennsylvania Ave., at the N.E. corner of Atlantic Ave., showing Apollo Hall, which was operated by Jos. Schluechtner, who owned this corner, and operated a billiard and pool room here in 1873, at the corner.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706237f-a.folder: Pennsylvania Avenue & Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

706238f-a.text:
87 Pennsylvania Ave., east side, at, adjoining and north of Atlantic Ave. Also shown is 2645-2651 Atlantic Ave., from and including Pennsylvania Ave., to, but not including New Jersey Ave. The buildings concerned are frame houses.
Juiy 27, 1939.
P. L. Sperr.
706238f-a.folder: Pennsylvania Avenue & Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
